reviews.text:
One of my favourite hotel stays . The rooms were small (we had a compact double ) but perfectly formed and well equipt . I was concerned about feeling cramped but I didn't at all. It was easy to store bags so they were well away and the bed was exceptionally comfortable.The bathroom was spacious with a great shower. There is also a communal kitchen you can use for tea or to make dinner .The hotel was spotlessly clean .
But! The very best thing was the breakfast . It was an incredible Swedish buffet with an amazing set of options and cracking coffee. We ate in the restaurant one night too and it was lovely .
The service was exceptional, all the staff were kind and attentive. We had a lovely waiter the night we ate there and as we left a staff member gave me a recipe. We won't stay anywhere else in Stockholm now .

Nice quiet location in the green, in a former prison and with a beach, where we could have a swim. The double room was clean, had comfy beds, and had a good shape bathroom. Very friendly staff. We loved the originality of the venue, the tiny museum and sitting in the garden of the restaurant. Plenty of free privat parking spaces available. Within a 10 minutes  there were also public transports.
We would love to come back.

About 15mins walk from metro station, the road was not flat was not friendly to wheels after the bridgeüòÇüòÇ I walked with my suitcase so hard to got there, it was the small rocks road. I arrived hotel early, I stored the luggage for free, and then went out. Came back about 3pm, the room was clean! Many guest rooms, provided hair dryer and body wash. A big window, with the sun came in in the morning üëçüèª Breakfast was good, super full, staff was niceüëçüèª A nice experience staying at a ex-prison hotelüòÇ

Five stars for exceptional service!

I recently had to cancel my stay at L√•ngholmen last minute due to unexpected health issues, and I was absolutely blown away by their level of customer service.
Although I didn't get to experience their wonderful amenities in person, their gesture of goodwill speaks volumes about their dedication to their guests.

I will absolutely be booking with them in the future, and I highly recommend them to anyone looking for a place that genuinely cares about its customers.

This was a fun hotel to experience. An old prison turned hotel it had a lot of charm.

There was a beach nearby, kayaking on the waterways, and a big park nearby.

Kind of far from the center of Stockholm, but still pretty dope since they have a really good train system.
